title: Full Trailer for 'Harlem Ice' Disney+ Doc About Harlem Figure Skaters
description: "We're hard on you... because I know that you guys can be great." Disney+ has revealed the official trailer for a docu series streaming in February called Harlem Ice, made by doc filmmaker Samantha Knowles. An empowering, uplifting documentary to debut during wintertime - it's produced by Imagine Entertainment. Harlem Ice is a 5-part documentary series following the girls of Figure Skating in Harlem as they prepare for competitions, performances and a life changing global experience. Through their eyes, we experience the highs and lows of the FSH Season, and the unique experiences they have as girls of color breaking the ice ceiling and gaining access to a global stage. We follow sisters Tori and Ashley, newbie Adrianna and senior Ariyana, and see how each girl makes her mark and helps to put Harlem Ice on the map. This looks exactly like the ideal Disney+ doc to feature as a way of inspiring more young people to go out and try new things. Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Samantha Knowles' doc Harlem Ice, direct from YouTube: Harlem Ice is a five-part documentary series following the coaches and girls of Figure Skating in Harlem, New York City, as they […]
author: Alex Billington

text: WORTH WATCHING by January 17, 2025Source: YouTube "We're hard on you... because I know that you guys can be great." Disney+ has revealed the official trailer for a docu series streaming in February called Harlem Ice, made by doc filmmaker Samantha Knowles. An empowering, uplifting documentary to debut during wintertime - it's produced by Imagine Entertainment. Harlem Ice is a 5-part documentary series following the girls of Figure Skating in Harlem as they prepare for competitions, performances and a life changing global experience. Through their eyes, we experience the highs and lows of the FSH Season, and the unique experiences they have as girls of color breaking the ice ceiling and gaining access to a global stage. We follow sisters Tori and Ashley, newbie Adrianna and senior Ariyana, and see how each girl makes her mark and helps to put Harlem Ice on the map. This looks exactly like the ideal Disney+ doc to feature as a way of inspiring more young people to go out and try new things. Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Samantha Knowles' doc Harlem Ice, direct from YouTube: Harlem Ice is a five-part documentary series following the coaches and girls of Figure Skating in Harlem, New York City, as they prepare for competitions, performances, and a life-changing global experience. Through their eyes, we experience the highs & lows of the Figure Skating in Harlem organization’s season and the unique experiences they have as girls of color breaking the “ice ceiling” and gaining access to a global stage. Harlem Ice is a docu series directed by the American doc filmmaker Samantha M. Knowles, director on the "Black and Missing" series previously, plus many other short films. Created by GMA's Robin Roberts, along with Imagine Documentaries. Executive produced by Sara Bernstein, Geeta Gandbhir, Brian Grazer, Ron Howard, Meredith Kaulfers, Robin Roberts, and Justin Wilkes. Disney debuts the Harlem Ice docu series streaming on Disney+ starting February 12th, 2025 coming soon this winter. Want to watch? Find more posts in: Documentaries, Streaming, To Watch prev next
html:
WORTH WATCHING

by
January 17, 2025
Source: YouTube

"We're hard on you... because I know that you guys can be great." Disney+ has revealed the official trailer for a docu series streaming in February called Harlem Ice, made by doc filmmaker Samantha Knowles. An empowering, uplifting documentary to debut during wintertime - it's produced by Imagine Entertainment. Harlem Ice is a 5-part documentary series following the girls of Figure Skating in Harlem as they prepare for competitions, performances and a life changing global experience. Through their eyes, we experience the highs and lows of the FSH Season, and the unique experiences they have as girls of color breaking the ice ceiling and gaining access to a global stage. We follow sisters Tori and Ashley, newbie Adrianna and senior Ariyana, and see how each girl makes her mark and helps to put Harlem Ice on the map. This looks exactly like the ideal Disney+ doc to feature as a way of inspiring more young people to go out and try new things.

Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Samantha Knowles' doc Harlem Ice, direct from YouTube:

Harlem Ice is a five-part documentary series following the coaches and girls of Figure Skating in Harlem, New York City, as they prepare for competitions, performances, and a life-changing global experience. Through their eyes, we experience the highs & lows of the Figure Skating in Harlem organization’s season and the unique experiences they have as girls of color breaking the “ice ceiling” and gaining access to a global stage. Harlem Ice is a docu series directed by the American doc filmmaker Samantha M. Knowles, director on the "Black and Missing" series previously, plus many other short films. Created by GMA's Robin Roberts, along with Imagine Documentaries. Executive produced by Sara Bernstein, Geeta Gandbhir, Brian Grazer, Ron Howard, Meredith Kaulfers, Robin Roberts, and Justin Wilkes. Disney debuts the Harlem Ice docu series streaming on Disney+ starting February 12th, 2025 coming soon this winter. Want to watch?

Find more posts in: Documentaries, Streaming, To Watch
